column4: hi i cant get the mouse working with the evdev driver anyone know whats wrong?
you may want to pastebin your xorg.conf an /var/log/Xorg.0.log
ok.. gotta learn how to pastebin first hehe :) brb
you need to use find (and -delete or -exec or pass to xargs) or in nice shell like zsh, you could do rm **/Thumbs.db
